title: Easeout Weekly #11
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Alpine.js Logo](/images/uploads/alpinejs.png) [Alpine.js](https://css-tricks.com/alpine-js-the-javascript-framework-thats-used-like-jquery-written-like-vue-and-inspired-by-tailwindcss/) An introduction to the JavaScript Framework that’s used like jQuery, written like Vue, and Inspired by TailwindCSS! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/alpine-js-the-javascript-framework-thats-used-like-jquery-written-like-vue-and-inspired-by-tailwindcss/)
![React Integration Testing Terminal](/images/uploads/fewer-tests.png) [React Integration Testing: Greater Coverage, Fewer Tests](https://css-tricks.com/react-integration-testing-greater-coverage-fewer-tests/) This article follows an exercise that starts with a simple website, validates behavior with unit and integration tests, and demonstrates how integration testing delivers greater value from fewer lines of code. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/react-integration-testing-greater-coverage-fewer-tests/)
![Connected Crowd](/images/uploads/openweb.jpg) [The Open Web is Dying](https://perezbox.com/2020/04/the-open-web-is-dying/) The open web is changing dramatically, and not for anything that resembles openness, and the world seems to be ok with it. [Read it ➡️](https://perezbox.com/2020/04/the-open-web-is-dying/)
![Video Progress Demo](/images/uploads/video-progress-element.png) [Some Innocent Fun With HTML Video and Progress](https://css-tricks.com/some-innocent-fun-with-html-video-and-progress/) A nice demo by Geoff Graham showing how we can use the progress value when working with video UI's. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/some-innocent-fun-with-html-video-and-progress/)
![Meet our team screenshot](/images/uploads/meet-our-team.png) [Meet our team!](https://codepen.io/pehaa/full/abvyeBo) A fun demo of an animated team page by Paulina Hetman. [Check it out ➡️](https://codepen.io/pehaa/full/abvyeBo)
![Wireframe examples](/images/uploads/why-you-fail-in-wireframe-design.png) [How To Succeed In Wireframe Design](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/wireframe-design-success/) In this article you’ll learn what wireframes are, why we need to design them, how to get the most out of the designs, and how to take it to the next level. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/wireframe-design-success/)
![Dark Mode Example](/images/uploads/dark-mode-resources-figure.png) [Implementing Dark Mode In React Apps](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/dark-mode-react-apps-styled-components/) In this article, we’ll learn how to efficiently implement dark mode in a React app on a simple web page, using the styled-components library and leveraging some React features like hooks. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/dark-mode-react-apps-styled-components/)
![Formik Logo](/images/uploads/formik.png) [Using Formik to Handle Forms in React](https://css-tricks.com/using-formik-to-handle-forms-in-react/) A guide to integrating Formik in a React component, while demonstrating the way it handles state, validation, and submissions. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/using-formik-to-handle-forms-in-react/)
![Readability Algorithms Article](/images/uploads/readability-algorithims.png) [Readability Algorithms Should Be Tools, Not Targets](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/readability-algorithms-tools-targets/) Readability programs may seem like a godsend, but the worst thing writers can do is write to please them above all others. Finding your voice is hard enough without also trying to sound like everyone else. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/05/readability-algorithms-tools-targets/)
![Technical Resume Watercolor](/images/uploads/watercolor-wireframes.png) [Advice for Writing a Technical Resume](https://css-tricks.com/advice-for-writing-a-technical-resume/) If you want to stand out in the crowd, make sure your resume is one that represents you well. This article has some useful advice! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/advice-for-writing-a-technical-resume/)
![Gulp with Blaine Bublitz](/images/uploads/gulp-blaine-bublitz.png) [Gulp with Blaine Bublitz](https://shoptalkshow.com/410/) A chat with Blaine Bublitz, lead at the Gulpjs open source project, about what Gulp is, the lack of money in open source, SVG and Gulp, handling dependencies in Gulp, and what the future of Gulp looks like. [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/410/)
![Nuxt tutorial app](/images/uploads/nuxt-landing.png) [Getting Started With Nuxt](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/getting-started-nuxt/) In this tutorial, we’re going to learn how to create server-side rendered applications by using Nuxt.js, how to configure your application for development, and how to deploy to Heroku. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/getting-started-nuxt/)

short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
